replication_study.hypothesis: German women report higher mean levels of general worry about COVID-19 (variable mh_anxiety_1; 5-point Likert scale) than German men.

data_plan.dataset_identifier: data_gerhold.csv  (public GitHub mirror, archived in replication_data)
data_plan.wave_or_subset: Single cross-section collected during the early COVID-19 pandemic (exact fieldwork date not included in file headers, but matches 2020 period of original).
data_plan.sample_size: 10,192 observations (after restriction CountryofLiving == 'Germany' and gender ∈ {1,2}; effective N reported by the script at runtime).
data_plan.access_details: CSV provided in /app/data via the replication_data folder (no additional restrictions).

qualification.explanation: The file contains the same questionnaire items used in Gerhold (2020) but represents a much larger, independently collected panel sample, allowing a robustness test of the gender–worry gap.
qualification.similarity_to_original: Key item mh_anxiety_1 (general COVID worry) and gender codings (1 = male, 2 = female) appear verbatim as in the original survey instrument (see original_paper.pdf, p. 5 Table 4; post_registration.json ‘outcome_variable’).
qualification.deviation_from_original: Original analysis used a representative sub-sample of 1,242 respondents collected 19–23 Mar 2020 (post_registration.json → data.wave_or_subset). The replication file contains 10,192 answers, indicating a different recruitment window/sample frame (replication_data/data_gerhold.csv shape).

data_plan.notes: All rows show CountryofLiving = 'Germany'; no time-stamp column. The file lacks the extensive psychometric items but retains the focal worry variables. Coding of ‘female’ column contains some NAs; script regenerates the indicator from gender.

steps: Filter rows to Germany and to gender codes 1 (male) or 2 (female).
Generate binary female indicator (1 = female, 0 = male).
Compute descriptive statistics for mh_anxiety_1 by gender.
Run independent-samples t-test (Student, equal_var decided by Levene).
Report means, SDs, t, df, p-value, and d.
planned_method.models: Independent-samples t-test; Cohen’s d for effect size.
planned_method.control_variables: None (simple two-group comparison replicates original focal claim).
planned_method.missing_data_handling: Listwise deletion on mh_anxiety_1 and gender.
planned_method.inference_criteria: Replicated if mean_female > mean_male and p < 0.05; effect size direction positive.

files.replication_data/replicate_claim.py: Loads the dataset, cleans sample, computes descriptive stats, performs Levene test, independent-samples t-test, and Cohen’s d; prints results.

codebase.notes: Original R script (Gerhold_covid_Azg9_0948_final.R) was translated into Python to comply with container execution guidelines. All file paths resolved inside /app/data.

analysis.instructions: Inside the container, run:  python replication_data/replicate_claim.py
analysis.comparison_metrics: Direction of gender difference, t-statistic, p-value, and Cohen’s d contrasted with original findings (original: 68.2 % vs 55.7 %, p < .01).
